election_record.label: New York 1819 State Senate, Middle District

sub_unit.name: Middle
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists 8382 votes for Charles E. Dudley, 8277 for John T. More, 7293 for Arunah Metcalf, 2356 for Abraham Van Vechten, and 967 for Solomon Southwick in the Middle District.

sub_unit.name: Westerlo
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists66 votes for John T. Moore and 70 votes for Solomon Southwick.

sub_unit.name: Chenango
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) lists 1070 votes for John T. Moore.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: The original election returns listed no votes from the towns of Colchester, Hancock, and Tompkins, and it appears that no election was held in these towns.

sub_unit.name: Delhi
sub_unit.note: Abraham Van Vechten received 1 vote as Abraham Van Vater in Delhi.

sub_unit.name: Meredith
sub_unit.note: Abraham Van Vechten received 1 vote as Abraham Vachten in Meredith.

sub_unit.name: Sidney
sub_unit.note: Abraham Van Vechten received 1 vote as Abraham G. Van Vetchen in Sidney.

sub_unit.name: Stamford
sub_unit.note: Abraham Van Vechten received 1 vote as Abram Van Vechten in Stamford.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: Arunah Metcalf received 1 vote as A. Metcalf in Greene county.
The Catskill Recorder (Catskill, NY), May 5, reports 184 votes for Elisha Jenkins in Greene County.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: Solomon Southwick received 1 vote as Solomon S. Southwick.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: Charles E. Dudley received 1 vote as Charles Dudley.

sub_unit.name: Burlington
sub_unit.note: Solomon Southwick received 1 vote as Solomon Southworth.

sub_unit.name: Middlefield
sub_unit.note: John T. Moore received 1 vote as John J. Moore.

sub_unit.name: Unadilla
sub_unit.note: The Otsego Herald (Cooperstown, NY), May 10, reports 28 votes for Elisha Jenkins in Unadilla.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: John T. Moore received 1 vote as John P. Moore.

election_record.reference: Original Election Certificate, Town of Middleburgh.
Orange County Patriot; or, the Spirit of Seventy-Six (Goshen, NY). April 13, 1819.
The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY). May 3, 1819.
The New-York Columbian (New York, NY). June 10, 1819.
